text: it wasn't until the police started
asking the crowd to move 20 feet back
from the front lines that things start
to get a little bit escalated the crowd
they they talk they got louder but after
the third time that the policeman had
said that then a young man threw a water
bottle at the front line and that's when
they threw the tear gas at us the
protesters are tired they're tired of
going through the same thing over and
over again I think what they want to see
is just some type of immediate change
like I said they weren't violent and it
wasn't it was just one guy that made it
escalate I think protesters just want to
see change in st. Louis Missouri they
want to see justice with Michael Brown
they want to see that things are being
done correctly they don't want to see
the same thing that happened with
Trayvon they don't want any more repeats
the protesters just want to see justice
for that young man
Mike last night it was said at a rally
it's almost like the black community is
experiencing deja vu when it comes to
the black crime of innocent young man
unarmed dying and staged abou and they
just want to see justice
